column8: Chunk missing from aft edge of rudder. Inflatable under bow blocking some access to hull. This was largely a “shearing” cleaning, wherein I removed the bulk of the hard growth but left a layer of algae to removed on the next service.

A much more time-intensive cleaning. 80% of the time is often required to get the last 20% clean. Going forward, I’m hoping cleanings will be faster now that we’ve gotten down to mostly clean paint again.

Paint biocide properties have failed. Hull will be sheared instead of scrubbed until repainting. This will remove protruding growth but prevent further paint from being scrubbed away. Paint will retain a “dirty” appearance after cleaning.
